snippet: Senator Dianne Feinstein says she will push to declassify parts of a hotly disputed report that accuses the C.I.A of misleading Congress and the White House.
abstract: Sen Dianne Feinstein, chairwoman of Senate Intelligence Committee, says she will push to declassify parts of hotly disputed secret committee report that accuses Central Intelligence Agency of misleading Congress and the White House about CIA's detention and interrogation program, which is now defunct.

byline.original: By MARK MAZZETTI and SCOTT SHANE

lead_paragraph: Senator Dianne Feinstein says she will push to declassify parts of a hotly disputed report that accuses the C.I.A of misleading Congress and the White House.

headline.main: Senate and C.I.A. Spar Over Secret Report on Interrogation Program
headline.print_headline: Senate and C.I.A. Spar Over Secret Report on Interrogation Program
